p: The essential oils from Hyptis brevipes, presenting methyl eugenol ( 254), 3-allylguaiacol ( 255) and β-caryophyllene ( 262) as the main compounds, and from Hyptis rhomboidea, whose main compounds were isocaryophyllene ( 270) and β-cadinene ( 261), have demonstrated to be effective against strains of Staphylococcus aureus, Bacillus cereus, Escherichia coli and Pseudomonas aeruginosa (MICs 3.125–50 μg/mL), being Hyptis brevipes oil slightly more effective ( Xu et al., 2013).
